Package chord

Class TopologyBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • chord.TopologyBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    repast.simphony.dataLoader.ContextBuilder<java.lang.Object>
    public class TopologyBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
implements repast.simphony.dataLoader.ContextBuilder<java.lang.Object>
    This class loads all the parameters, initializes the Chord ring and the nodes and then schedules insertion/leaving/lookup batches

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      TopologyBuilder()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      repast.simphony.context.Context<java.lang.Object> build​(repast.simphony.context.Context<java.lang.Object> context)
      Repast constructor: loads the simulation parameters; initializes the Chord ring and the nodes; generates the data and assigns them to the nodes; schedules leavings, insertions and lookups Two different initialization strategies can be chosen trough the one_at_time_init simulator parameter Two different lookups strategies can be chosen trough the one_key_lookup simulator parameter
      void data_generation​(int m, int key_size, int data_size, int total_number_data)
      Creates total_number_data random strings that will be the data; each string is data_size characters long and the first key_size characters are used as key
      void debug()
      Prints some statistics about the lookups performed
      java.lang.Integer firstNotCrashed​(java.lang.Integer key)
      Returns the first initialized and not crashed node with an id greater or equal than the hash value provided
      void forced_to_leave​(Node node)
      Removes the specified node from the active ones and add an additional node to the next join batch
      int getForcedToLeave()
      Return the number of nodes that have been forced to leave
      void getLookupsResults()
      Writes a CSV file with all the lookups performed
      void join_new_nodes​(repast.simphony.context.Context<java.lang.Object> context, repast.simphony.space.continuous.ContinuousSpace<java.lang.Object> space)
      This method inserts a variable number of nodes (between min_number_joins and this.min_number_joins + join_amplitude + additional_joins) in the chord ring periodically; if all the available nodes are already in the ring, no new nodes are inserted.
      void leaving_nodes​(repast.simphony.context.Context<java.lang.Object> context, repast.simphony.space.continuous.ContinuousSpace<java.lang.Object> space, double join_interval)
      This method removes a variable number of nodes (between min_number_leave and this.min_number_leave + leave_amplitude) from the chord ring periodically; at least one node is left in the ring.
      void lookupMultipleKeys()
      Lookup strategy in which each node looks for a random key
      void lookupSingleKey()
      Lookup strategy in which all nodes look for the same key (the key is different at every lookup batch)
      repast.simphony.util.collections.Pair<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>,​java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> missingWrongSuccessors​(Node node, java.util.ArrayList<Node> successors, java.lang.Integer hashSize, java.lang.Integer max_succ_size)
      Returns a pair of lists containing the missing successors and the wrong ones w.r.t. the ones provided
      void nodeExit​(repast.simphony.context.Context<java.lang.Object> context, Node node, java.util.HashSet<Node> leaving_nodes)
      Removes the node from the active ones and assign his data to the first greater node in the ring
      void one_at_time_init​(int init_num_nodes, double insertion_delay, repast.simphony.context.Context<java.lang.Object> context, repast.simphony.space.continuous.ContinuousSpace<java.lang.Object> space)
      Initialization strategy in which the nodes are inserted one at a time providing them with a random node already present the chord ring insertion_delay ticks are waited between two insertions in order to allow the new node to perform at least one stabilization
      void printAll()
      Prints debug information about all active nodes

      • build

        public repast.simphony.context.Context<java.lang.Object> build​(repast.simphony.context.Context<java.lang.Object> context)
        Repast constructor: loads the simulation parameters; initializes the Chord ring and the nodes; generates the data and assigns them to the nodes; schedules leavings, insertions and lookups Two different initialization strategies can be chosen trough the one_at_time_init simulator parameter Two different lookups strategies can be chosen trough the one_key_lookup simulator parameter
        Specified by:
        build in interface repast.simphony.dataLoader.ContextBuilder<java.lang.Object>
        Parameters:
        context - context of repast
        Returns:
        the created context

      • one_at_time_init

        public void one_at_time_init​(int init_num_nodes,
                             double insertion_delay,
                             repast.simphony.context.Context<java.lang.Object> context,
                             repast.simphony.space.continuous.ContinuousSpace<java.lang.Object> space)
        Initialization strategy in which the nodes are inserted one at a time providing them with a random node already present the chord ring insertion_delay ticks are waited between two insertions in order to allow the new node to perform at least one stabilization
        Parameters:
        init_num_nodes - the number of nodes to initialize
        insertion_delay - numbers of ticks between two insertions; it should be greater or equal than stab_offset+stab_amplitude
        context - reference to the context
        space - reference to the 2D space

      • data_generation

        public void data_generation​(int m,
                            int key_size,
                            int data_size,
                            int total_number_data)
        Creates total_number_data random strings that will be the data; each string is data_size characters long and the first key_size characters are used as key
        Parameters:
        m - hash size
        key_size - number of characters used as key
        data_size - lenght of the data
        total_number_data - total number of data that will be generated

      • lookupMultipleKeys

        public void lookupMultipleKeys()
        Lookup strategy in which each node looks for a random key

      • lookupSingleKey

        public void lookupSingleKey()
        Lookup strategy in which all nodes look for the same key (the key is different at every lookup batch)

      • getLookupsResults

        public void getLookupsResults()
        Writes a CSV file with all the lookups performed

      • leaving_nodes

        public void leaving_nodes​(repast.simphony.context.Context<java.lang.Object> context,
                          repast.simphony.space.continuous.ContinuousSpace<java.lang.Object> space,
                          double join_interval)
        This method removes a variable number of nodes (between min_number_leave and this.min_number_leave + leave_amplitude) from the chord ring periodically; at least one node is left in the ring. In order to be sure that the nodes in the ring are correct the first call is scheduled after stab_offset+stab_amplitude ticks since the last insertion in the initialization phase. Two consecutive leavings are separated by one tick. After the first call the method is scheduled every leave_interval.
        Parameters:
        context - reference to the context
        space - reference to the continuous space
        join_interval - number of ticks between the last leaving and the insertions

      • nodeExit

        public void nodeExit​(repast.simphony.context.Context<java.lang.Object> context,
                     Node node,
                     java.util.HashSet<Node> leaving_nodes)
        Removes the node from the active ones and assign his data to the first greater node in the ring
        Parameters:
        context - reference to the context
        node - node that has to leave the ring
        leaving_nodes - set of nodes leaving the ring

      • forced_to_leave

        public void forced_to_leave​(Node node)
        Removes the specified node from the active ones and add an additional node to the next join batch
        Parameters:
        node - node that leaves the ring

      • join_new_nodes

        public void join_new_nodes​(repast.simphony.context.Context<java.lang.Object> context,
                           repast.simphony.space.continuous.ContinuousSpace<java.lang.Object> space)
        This method inserts a variable number of nodes (between min_number_joins and this.min_number_joins + join_amplitude + additional_joins) in the chord ring periodically; if all the available nodes are already in the ring, no new nodes are inserted. In order to ensure that the nodes in the ring are correct, the insertions are scheduled after stab_offset+stab_amplitude ticks since the last leaving
        Parameters:
        context - reference to the context
        space - reference to the 2D space

      • missingWrongSuccessors

        public repast.simphony.util.collections.Pair<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>,​java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> missingWrongSuccessors​(Node node,
                                                                                                                                                         java.util.ArrayList<Node> successors,
                                                                                                                                                         java.lang.Integer hashSize,
                                                                                                                                                         java.lang.Integer max_succ_size)
        Returns a pair of lists containing the missing successors and the wrong ones w.r.t. the ones provided
        Parameters:
        node - the node of interest
        successors - the successors list of the node of interest
        hashSize - the hash size
        max_succ_size - the maximum size of the successors list
        Returns:
        a pair (ArrayList(Integer),ArrayList(Integer)) containing the missing successors and the wrong ones w.r.t. the ones provided
